snippet: The scale of the humanitarian needs and the growing sectarian animosity in the Central African Republic threaten to overwhelm France’s goal of quickly restoring order.
abstract: Crisis in Central African Republic is proving more complicated, violent and desperate than French officials expected, with scale of humanitarian needs and growing animosity between Christians and Muslims threatening to overwhelm Pres Francois Hollande's goal of restoring order, disarming militias, expediting aid and preparing for 2014 elections.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The scale of the humanitarian needs and the growing sectarian animosity in the Central African Republic threaten to overwhelm France’s goal of quickly restoring order.

headline.main: African Crisis Is Tougher Than France Expected
headline.print_headline: African Crisis Is Tougher Than France Expected

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
